result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake Neil Martinson-Packer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- 60 days credit against ultimate sentence.
- Defendant to be held until DOC meets with him to sign up for probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: any status in Minnesota.

miscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs. Apply bond. Balance payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County Case 22CF404.
- $250 DNA Surcharge. Apply bond. Balance payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County Case 22CF404.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Write apology letters to E.M. and O.M.
- Participate in any program agent lines up to address sobriety.
- Test randomly and regularly.
- Maintain current mental health treatment.
- Pay supervision fees.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake Neil Martinson-Packer

records.addlTxt: ec: attys, e: DOC, c: SCSO, DE via mail.  gll

9:57 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Blake Neil Martinson-Packer in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Blake Neil Martinson-Packer.  Court reviews files, notes PH needs to be held. Set for BBH.  Atty Harrelson states there is an active WA in Dakota county at this time, there was an offer sent to defense, asking to plead this morning if possible.  Off Record at 10:01 AM.  Back on at 10:22 AM.  Appearances as previously noted. Court calls 22CF404 & 22CM346. ADA Smestad recites joint agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  Court questions parties on waiver of prelim for 22CF404.   Atty Harrelson states DE would like to waive prelim.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court proceeds to PLEAS. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 22CF404. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1- Forgery-Uttering in 22CF404. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses and reads in 22CM346 for restitution purposes. PSI is waived. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF404

S/W 2 Years Probation- Concurrent with any status in MN

- Court Costs: $268.00  
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
  Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- Pay restitution if any owed
- Write apology letters to E.M & O.M.
- Absolute Sobriety
- Participate in any program agent lines up to address sobriety
- Test randomly and regularly 
- Maintain current mental health treatment
- Pursue high school equivalency
- DE to be held until DOC meets with him to sign up for probation
- Pay supervision fees

60 days credit against ultimate sentence

Adjourned at 10:58 AM
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond. Filed by Atty Harrelson.  gll   to rg 8/12
Bail/bond hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
from JA to SRN re judicial transfer.  gll

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

INCLUDES 22CF404 and 22CM346

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Eliza M. and Olaf M., Rachel G. and Wal-Mart in new Richmond, WI. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:38 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:   Brian Thomas Smestad and Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF:  Blake Neil Martinson-Packer appeared from jail. INCLUDES 22CF404 and 22CM346. DE qualifies for public defender. 22CF404: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. 22CM346: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading.  NG. State requests bond. Court orders bond. Prelim time limits waived. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:45 PM. kma
